update.description:
The `BaseInspectorDialog` is ued to reduce the code duplication for other dialogs in build editor:   
`color` and `texture` related member variable and functions are moved to `BaseInspectorDialog`  

The branch has merged with [issue_1363](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/branch/issue_1363) to resolve some conflicts   

`code_check.sh` run with `0` errors  

[Jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-external-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/18/)
update.title: Base class for inspectorDialog for build editor

pullrequest.title: Base class for inspectorDialog for build editor

content.raw: I see what you mean. It should be ok to make the ones which are `QLabel` be `QLineEdit` and just make sure to set them to be read only (`setReadOnly(true)`), but I think this can be done in the future. This pull request is good to introduce the base class, we don't want it to get too long.
content.html: I see what you mean. It should be ok to make the ones which are QLabel be QLineEdit and just make sure to set them to be read only (setReadOnly(true)), but I think this can be done in the future. This pull request is good to introduce the base class, we don't want it to get too long.

pull_request.title: Base class for inspectorDialog for build editor

pullrequest.title: Base class for inspectorDialog for build editor

content.raw:
The name for `LevelInspectorDialog` is [QLineEdit *](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/92da614daa0fed41a7c3cce2db95c0f427b65e6a/gazebo/gui/building/LevelInspectorDialog.hh#cl-94)  
while for the other `inspectorDialog`s, they are all [QLabel *](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/92da614daa0fed41a7c3cce2db95c0f427b65e6a/gazebo/gui/building/WallInspectorDialog.hh?at=default#cl-157)  
I am not sure whether there are differences.   
I will remove it for now, since there are multiple other functions  
that can be moved to Base function, such as `GetHeight`, `SetHeight`, `SetName`, etc
content.html:
The name for LevelInspectorDialog is QLineEdit *
while for the other inspectorDialogs, they are all QLabel *
I am not sure whether there are differences.
I will remove it for now, since there are multiple other functions
that can be moved to Base function, such as GetHeight, SetHeight, SetName, etc
